fields.Title of Presentation: Enhanced suppression of transmission with joint  medical and entomological control measures
fields.Conference / Meeting Name: American Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
fields.Description/Abstract:
Using  both  openmalaria  simulation  and  a  variant  Ross­
MacDonald  transmission  model,  we  report  on  enhanced  infection  prevalence 
suppression  with  the  joint  deployment  of  two  interventions:  mass  drug 
administration  (MDA)  and  indoor  residual  spraying  (IRS).  Deployed 
synchronously, or nearly so, they have a strong synergistic effect that enhances 
host  disease  control  well  beyond  the  effects  of  two  individual,  temporally­
isolated  interventions.  The  pronounced  infection  suppression  established  in  a 
short time scale by an MDA with good coverage is sustained, or augmented by 
the  longer­scale  IRS  campaign.  This  enhanced  control  is  most  prominent  in 
high­transmission settings, but  also with modest and somewhat longer lasting 
gains in mid­to­low transmissive areas. We discuss regimes of efficacy and policy 
implications.
